title: How to Make Cookie Dough Fudge

steps.headline: Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
steps.description: Tear off two large pieces of parchment paper. Lay them down crosswise onto a 9 by 9-inch (22.86 by 22.86-centimeter) baking pan, so that the bottoms and sides are covered. Leave a few inches of parchment paper hanging off the sides of the pan so that you can lift the fudge out.

steps.headline: Cream the butter, heavy cream, and condensed milk.
steps.description: Pour the heavy cream and condensed milk into a mixer. Add the butter, and mix together using a medium speed setting until the mixture is thick and creamy.

steps.headline: Mix in the vanilla extract and the brown sugar.
steps.description: Stir in the vanilla extract, then add the brown sugar. Mix everything together using a medium speed setting. Some time to time, pause the mixer, and scrap down the sides of the bowl using a rubber spatula. This ensures that everything gets evenly blended.

steps.headline: Slowly mix in the flour and powdered sugar.
steps.description: Lower the speed on your mixer, and add in the flour and sugar. Keep pausing the mixer and scraping the batter down the walls of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Keep mixing until everything is smooth.

steps.headline: Stir in the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Once the batter is smooth, add in the chocolate chips. Stir them in using a rubber spatula. Be sure to scrape the bottom and sides of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Pour the batter into the pan.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to scrape everything out of the bowl and into the pan. Smooth the fudge down as best you can.

steps.headline: Allow the batter to chill in the fridge for 2 to 3 hours.
steps.description: Transfer the baking pan into the refrigerator. Leave it there for 2 to 3 hours, or until the fudge turns solid.

steps.headline: Cut and serve the fudge.
steps.description: Take hold of the excess parchment paper, and use it to lift the fudge out of the pan. Set the fudge down, then cut it into 1-inch (2.54-centimeter) squares.

steps.headline: Line a baking dish with parchment paper.
steps.description: Tear off two large pieces of parchment paper. Lay them down crosswise into an 8 by 8-inch (20.32 by 20.32-centimeter) baking dish so that the bottom and sides are covered. Leave a few inches of parchment paper hanging off the edges to that you can remove the fudge later.

steps.headline: Prepare the cookie dough.
steps.description: Cream the butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar using an electric mixer for about 3 minutes or until they are light and fluffy. Mix in the vanilla extract, salt, and half-and-half. Stir in the flour until everything is smooth. Set it aside when done. This will be the cookie dough flavoring for your fudge. Make sure that you are only using the ingredients from the cookie dough portion for this.

steps.headline: Heat the brown sugar, butter, salt, and half-and-half.
steps.description: Cut the butter into cubes, and put it into a saucepan. Add in the brown sugar, salt, and half-and-half. Heat the mixture over medium-low heat, stirring often, until the butter melts and the sugar dissolves.

steps.headline: Add in the powdered sugar.
steps.description: Take the saucepan off the burner. Stir in the powdered sugar 1 cup (cc grams) at a time until the mixture is smooth. You will need 4 to 5 cups (500 to 625 grams) of powdered sugar total.

steps.headline: Stir in the vanilla extract.
steps.description: Once the mixture is smooth, measure out the vanilla extract and add it in. Stir it in until it is evenly distributed and there are no streaks or swirls. This will lend a subtle cookie-light flavor to your fudge.

steps.headline: Add the cookie dough base into the fudge base.
steps.description: Keep stirring with a rubber spatula until the two are evenly blended together. Make sure that there are no lumps or clumps.

steps.headline: Stir in the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Measure out the chocolate chips, and add them into the bowl. Use a rubber spatula to fold them in, scraping the bottom and sides of the bowl often.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture into the baking dish.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to scrape the mixture from the bowl so that you don't waste any. Try to smooth the top of the fudge down as best you can.

steps.headline: Refrigerate the fudge.
steps.description: Place the entire baking pan into the fridge. Leave it there until it turns solid. This will take about 2 to 3 hours.

steps.headline: Combine the ingredients for the cookie dough.
steps.description: Mix together the butter, brown sugar, white sugar, milk, and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Stir in the flour until the batter turns to dough. Fold in the chocolate chips. Make sure that you are using only the ingredients from the cookie dough portion of the recipe for this. If you are sort on time or ingredients, you can use refrigerated, store-bought cookie dough instead. Simply roll it into balls and store it in the freezer.

steps.headline: Roll the dough into small balls.
steps.description: Aim to make the balls about ½ inch (1.27 centimeters) wide. This will make the cookie dough chunks in your fudge. If you'd like, you can use a tablespoon, a melon scoop, or a small cookie scoop to make the balls instead.

steps.headline: Freeze the cookie dough balls.
steps.description: Arrange the balls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Place the baking sheet into the freezer. The balls will harden as you prepare the rest of the fudge. This will help the balls keep their shape once you add them to the fudge base. You don't need to freeze the cookie dough balls for a specific amount of time. The time that it takes for you to prepare the rest of the fudge will be plenty.

steps.headline: Line a baking pan with parchment paper.
steps.description: Tear off two large pieces of parchment paper. Lay them down crosswise into a 9 by 13-inch  (22.86 by 33.02-centimeter) baking pan so that the bottom and sides are covered. Leave some parchment paper hanging off the sides of the pan so that you can lift the fudge out later.

steps.headline: Heat the butter, white sugar, brown sugar, and evaporated milk over medium heat.
steps.description: Cut the butter into small cubes and put it into a large saucepan. Add the white sugar, brown sugar, and evaporated milk. Heat the ingredients together over medium heat until the butter melts.

steps.headline: Boil the mixture for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
steps.description: Allow the mixture to come to a rolling boil, stirring constantly. Once it comes to a boil, reduce the heat to low. Allow it to boil for 4 to 5 more minutes, stirring constantly.

steps.headline: Add the chocolate chips.
steps.description: Take the saucepan off the burner. Stir in the semi-sweet chocolate chips and the milk chocolate chips. Keep stirring until they are completely melted and mixed in.

steps.headline: Stir in the marshmallow cream.
steps.description: Once the chocolate chips are melted and mixed in, add the marshmallow cream. Keep stirring with a rubber spatula until the marshmallow cream is blended and the mixture is smooth.

steps.headline: Pour half of the batter into the pan.
steps.description: Use a rubber spatula to distribute it evenly across the bottom. Save the rest of the fudge for later.

steps.headline: Add the frozen cookie dough balls.
steps.description: Take the cookie dough balls out of the freezer. Place them into the baking pan with the fudge in it, spacing them evenly.

steps.headline: Pour the rest of the fudge over the cookie dough balls.
steps.description: Try to spread it as evenly and a smoothly as you can. Make sure that the cookie dough balls are completely covered.

steps.headline: Chill the fudge.
steps.description: Place the entire baking sheet into the refrigerator. Leave it there until the fudge cools and sets, about 2 to 3 hours.

steps.headline: Cut the fudge into small squares.
steps.description: Use the overhanging parchment paper to list the fudge out of the baking pan. Set it down on a flat surface. Cut it into 1-inch (2.54-centimeter) squares using a sharp knife.

steps.headline: Finished.
Finished.
